attributes.action: End the practice of intimidatory interviews for mental health sufferers who are claiming disablity benefits.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The DWP is fast becoming notorious for making unfair decisions about individual claims for disablity benefits.  Their interviews are conducted by people with no medical understanding. let alone equality/respect training.  
This leads to unfair and incorrect decisions about individual claims.

The humiliation (of personal and accusatory questioning) suffered by genuine claimants is bad enough.  For those with mental health issues, the stress and fear of these interviews can make the situation unbearable.  

The prime minister should order an end to the practice of interviewing people with mental illness immediately to prevent further distress and deterioration of health.

Assessments for vulnerble individuals should be based on medical statements and not on face to face interviews.
